tagline: Straight talk on payroll, time tracking, and HR for blue collar teams.

audience.description: Owners and managers who run crews on jobsites, not employees in cubicles.
audience.workerMix: Mix of W2 employees and 1099 subcontractors across one or more jobsites

positioning.promise: Help small crew-based businesses pick a boring, reliable payroll and time tracking setup that works every pay period.
nonGoals: Do not sell payroll services or consulting.
Do not write generic 'top 10 tools' listicles.
Do not chase trendy tools that do not fit field crews.

topicClusters: time tracking and scheduling for crews
basic accounting and job costing for small crews

rules: Prioritize examples from real crew scenarios.
Avoid fluffy intros; get to the point in the first few sentences.
Always include at least one practical checklist or step-by-step sequence.

links.internalLinks: Link to other relevant articles on payrollforcrews.com wherever it genuinely helps the reader go deeper.
links.affiliateLinks: Use /go/... redirect links or the affiliateUrl from config/products.json. Do not paste raw affiliate URLs in articles if a /go/... route exists.
